cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface on an object.

div.l: When the goose, who was one/alone
Standing in the ... of the fowler
The raven
Was standing, you are on the parapet(!?) of the temple/house(?!)
(And said) “when you were high-(ranging?), when you were wide(-ranging?)
Why(?) do you (now) stand (here)?”
(The Goose said) “Your net was laid down for me
(The fowler) is the one who set down your seed for me
Your net holds me(?) to your benefit (i.e., instead of you)”
(The raven said(?)) “(But) why(?) have you(?) not uprooted your net?
(Why) can't you(?) fly away?” he said
“The snare has taken hold (of me)(?)
(and thus) I cannot fly away” he said
The goose spoke to the raven
... and you (are?) upon me
May/thus you(?) seize/pass towards my ...
The raven answered the goose
Your cast net(?), your ... net
... (am I?) below you, (or am I) above you?(?)
... (am I?) above you, (or am I) below you?(?)
The spouse of the fowler was listening(!?)
... had ... there
Your net was laid out
... placed your seed
And thus you net catches for him
The goose spoke to the raven
... (am I?) below you, (or am I) above you?(?)
... below you
... your net ...
... did not know
